#Text=West Bengal
#Text=West Bengal is a state in India 's East region .
#Text=Cities
#Text=Here are 10 of the most notable cities .
#Text=— centre of Bengali culture , the largest city in the state , current capital of West Bengal and former capital of British India until 1911 , is known as the " City of Palaces "
#Text=— a fortified British cantonment with Dutch , French , Mughal and Portuguese architecture and remniscences
#Text=— a major agricultural town
#Text=— a former French colony
#Text=— a beautiful hill station and centre of a major tea growing area
#Text=— an industrial metropolis
#Text=— Kolkata 's twin city , the second-largest in the state , with the largest railway complex in India
#Text=— former capital of Bengal under the Mughals
#Text=— a major business and shopping centre and gateway for travellers to Sikkim
#Text=— business capital of birbhum district , major tourist destination and gateway for travelers to North Bengal .
#Text=Other destinations
#Text=— a low lying hill in Purulia district
#Text=( Parmaden Forest ) —
#Text=— a forested area located in Buxa Hills is habitat for tigers , Asian elephants and other mammals plus a variety of birds , amphibians and reptiles
#Text=— famous for the Hindu temple of Goddess Kali known as Bhavatarini , an aspect of Kali , meaning , ' She who liberates Her devotees from the ocean of existence i. e Saṃsāra ' .
#Text=Situated on the eastern bank of the Hooghly River , near Kolkata
#Text=the temple was built by Rani Rashmoni , a philanthropist and a devotee of Kali in 1855 .
#Text=The temple is famous for its association with Ramakrishna a mystic of 19th century Bengal

#Text=— deltaic island on the mouth of river Hoogly , a major pilgrimage site
#Text=( Sandakphu ) — at 3,636 metres ( 11,929 ft ) is the highest point in West Bengal .
#Text=Kanchenjunga and Mount Everest are visible from here
#Text=— town of Rabindranath Tagore 's university Viswa Bharathi and known for exotic handmade goods

#Text=UNESCO World Heritage site
#Text=History
#Text=West Bengal 's history dates back before 20,000 years .
#Text=The region was a part of the Vanga Kingdom , the kingdom of Magadha .
#Text=Bengal had ancient trade relations with Burma ( Myanmar ) , Thailand and Sumatra .
#Text=She was invaded by Rajendra Chola I of Chola Dynasty between 1021 and 1023 .
#Text=During the 12th century Sufi missionaries arrived in Bengal , bringing along with them the message of Islam .
#Text=Bakhtiar Khilji , a military commander from the Delhi Sultanate , overran Bengal between 1202 and 1206 .
#Text=Bengal was conquered by the Mughals in 1576 .
#Text=There were several independent Hindu states established in Bengal during the Mughal period like those of Maharaja Pratap Aditya of Jessore and Raja Sitaram Ray of Burdwan .
#Text=Koch Bihar Kingdom in the northern Bengal flourished during the 16th and 17th centuries .
#Text=European traders arrived late in the 15th century .
#Text=The Battle of Plassey in 1757 saw the defeat of Siraj ud-Daulah , the last independent Nawab of Bengal .

#Text=Presidency was established by 1765 , eventually including all British territories north of the Central Provinces ( now Madhya Pradesh ) , from the mouths of the Ganges and the Brahmaputra to the Himalayas and the Punjab .
#Text=Calcutta was named the capital of British India in 1772 .
#Text=The Bengal Renaissance and Brahmo Samaj movement had great impact on the cultural and economic life of Bengal .
#Text=There was a failed uprising against British rule in 1857 known as the " Sepoy Mutiny " .
#Text=Between 1905 and 1911 , attempts were made to divide the province of Bengal into two zones , to curb nationalism , but widespread protest forced the British to call it off .
#Text=Bengal played a major role in the Indian independence movement , producing some of Indian 's greatest revolutionaries including Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose .
#Text=When India gained independence in 1947 , Bengal was partitioned along religious lines .

#Text=The western part went to India ( and was named West Bengal ) while the eastern part joined Pakistan as a province called East Bengal ( later renamed East Pakistan , giving rise to independent Bangladesh in 1971 ) .
#Text=In 1950 , the Princely State of Cooch Behar merged with West Bengal .
#Text=In 1955 , the former French enclave of Chandannagar was integrated into West Bengal .
#Text=The 1970s saw the rise of Left-Radicals in the name of Maoism , with a significant portion of the youth refusing to recognize the independence of 1947 .
#Text=Incidents surrounding the Bangladesh Liberation War of 1971 caused millions of refugees to influx into West Bengal , most of them Hindus .

#Text=The Left Front , led by the Communist Party of India ( Marxist ) , governed the state for the subsequent three decades , making it the longest serving democratically elected communist party in the world .

#Text=Although they were defeated in the 2011 elections , the Communists ' imprint remains powerful on the state , with many streets named after Marx and other local and foreign revolutionary figures .
#Text=Geography

#Text=West Bengal is diverse in terms of geography and is distinctively unique for being the only state in India with mountains in the north and sea in the south , with vast stretches of plains , plateaus and deltas between them .
#Text=The Eastern Himalaya range starts abruptly up from the Terai region near Siliguri .
#Text=The region is further divided into two parts : the Singalila and Darjeeling ranges .
#Text=The Singalila range is located along the border of Darjeeling and Nepal .
#Text=Sandakfu at 3,636 metres ( 11,929 ft ) is the highest point of West Bengal .
#Text=Remnants of the Siwaliks can be seen in the Jalpaiguri district , where they are known as the Buxa-Jayanti Hills .
#Text=The Terai is a belt of marshy grasslands , savannas and forests at the base of the Himalaya range .
#Text=The Dooar region stretching across the middle of the Terai belt are a conglomerate of tall grasslands , savannas and evergreen and deciduous forests .
#Text=South of Terai region the plain of North Bengal starts and continues up to the left bank of the Ganges .
#Text=It gets fed by rivers and rivulets originating in the Eastern Himalaya .
#Text=The Rarh lies south of the Ganges and east of the Chotanagpur plateau , eastern part of which is in West Bengal .
#Text=Part of the Sunderbans is located in the vast deltaic region , South-East of the state .
#Text=Climate
#Text=Bengal experiences 5 seasons : Spring , Summer , Monsoon , Autmn and Winter .
#Text=Spring is short and more dominant in the northern region .
#Text=Summer commemces from the first week of March and continues till June .
#Text=The weather remains hot and humid during the day , accompanied by cool breezes at night .
#Text=The western highlands will experience a hot dry climate .
#Text=Thunderstorms locally called Kalbaishakhi occurs late summer .
#Text=Monsoon starts from July and ends late September , when torrential rainfall gives rise to severe floods in the south .
#Text=Autmn is short , between October and mid-November .
#Text=The retreating monsoon at this time may give rise to storms .
#Text=Winter sets by late November and continues till Spring arrives in February , January being the coldest .
#Text=The Himalayan region in the north experiences snowfall during winter , usually after mid-December .
